intro: Dictyosperma album var. rubrum, commonly known as the red-flowered arrowroot. This variant is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Pacific and Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Araceae family and is characterized by its striking red bracts that surround the small, white flowers. The plant produces edible tubers similar to those of the common arrowroot, which are used in culinary applications. Its botanical features include broad, arrow-shaped leaves and a rhizomatous growth habit.
